tn.ref: the areas of land that the people of Israel received as their inheritance
tn.text: The land that the people of Israel acquired is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they received as a permanent possession. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: assigned to them by Eleazar the priest, by Joshua son of Nun, and by the tribal leaders of their ancestors' families within the people of Israel
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the tribal leaders of their ancestors' families within the people of Israel assigned to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"leaders of the tribes"

tn.ref: Their inheritance was selected by lot
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Eleazar, Joshua, and the tribal leaders cast lots to determine the inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here the word "hand" refers to Moses himself and means that Yahweh used Moses as the agent to deliver his command. AT: "through Moses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: Moses had given the inheritance of the two and one-half tribes beyond the Jordan, but to the Levites he gave no inheritance
tn.text: half tribes beyond the Jordan, but to the Levites he gave no inheritance** - The land that Moses gave to the tribes is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they received as a permanent possession. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: The Levites were given no portion of the inheritance in the land
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "And Moses did not give a portion of the inheritance to the Levites in the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"part"

tn.ref: but only certain cities to live in
tn.text: The verb may be supplied from the previous phrase. AT: "but he gave to them only certain cities to live in" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
fields of grass for the livestock to eat
physical things they needed so they could provide for their families
This is a man's name. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a people group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: I brought him a report again as it was in my heart to make
tn.text: Here the word "heart" represents the thoughts. The phrase is an idiom that refers to a report that is given honestly. AT: "I brought back to him an honest report" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: made the heart of the people melt with fear
tn.text: Making the people very afraid is spoken of as if it were making the hearts of the people melt. AT: "made the people very afraid" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Being loyal to Yahweh is spoken of as if it were completely following Yahweh. AT: "I remained loyal to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the land ... will be an inheritance for you and for your children forever
tn.text: The land that Caleb and his descendants would have is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they would receive as a permanent possession. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the land on which your foot has walked
tn.text: Here "your foot" represents Caleb. AT: "the land on which you have walked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This means "listen." This word adds emphasis to what is said next.

tn.ref: while Israel walked in the wilderness
tn.text: "while the people of Israel traveled in the wilderness"

tn.ref: My strength is now as my strength was then
tn.text: "I am still as strong now as I was then"
This is an idiom that refers to daily activities. AT: "for the things I do every day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Possible meanings are 1) many large hills or small mountains or 2) one mountain.
This is the name of a people group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: gave Hebron as an inheritance to Caleb
tn.text: Hebron is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that Caleb received as a permanent possession. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This refers to the period of time in which the author wrote this book.
Being loyal to Yahweh is spoken of as if it were completely following Yahweh. AT: "he remained loyal to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Then the land had rest from war
tn.text: The people no longer fighting wars is spoken of as if the land were a person who rested from war. See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:11:23|11:23]]. AT: "Then the people no longer fought wars in the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
